ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I had previous knowledge in Japanese and placed into this course. I found that this course helped me develop my language skills to a more natural flow. I got used to speaking in Japanese on a daily basis, albeit a few grammar errors here and there, and it made me comfortable talking to Japanese friends and superiors.
Great advances in grammatical forms, kanji, vocabulary etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I felt that the flexibility of the program was its biggest strength. The kindness and understanding Seto-sensei and Maruyama-sensei showed during the course of this semester was incredible, and encouraged me to not give up and still try my best to excel at this discipline. The other strength is the extremely fair grading system- every answer has a number of points, and each mistake results in different deductions. That also made me feel like my efforts are appreciated and in turn encouraged me to try my best.

Small class size is very helpful for learning, instructors are excellent at making content interesting. I feel my spoken ability developed least compared to other skills, more chances to speak in class may help.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but only to those with a clear commitment towards Japan or languages. The workload is intensive, but it is worth it for anyone with the slightest interest in East Asia.
Yes, if they are willing to devote the time to learning Japanese.
